answers.answer: i dont know anything about endos or night sweats, but when i was diagnosed with hashimotos, my lymph nodes were swollen and sore all the time (have since gotten better with thyroid treatment), and i was pale with dark circles under my eyes. i was also so tired i had to sleep in  my lunch break at work every day! so yeah those symptoms are normal.

There are very good pediatric endos out there just like there are great adult endos - the key is to find one who treats thyroid disorders.  I have a pediatric endo who only deals with diabetes (for my son)  - my regular endo deals with thyroids only and he has treated me and my daughter (since she was 16).  Call and ask - thyroid disorders are a bit of a speciality.  Do you have a children's hospital near you that you could call and ask?

question: Hi!  My 6-year-old daughter was just diagnosed with Hashimotos.  We took her in for an enlarged thyroid (we could see it in her school picture).  I don't have a copy of her lab results.  The pediatrician told me that her TSH was high, her T4 and T3 were normal and she tested positive for antithyroglobin antibodies.  He put her on levothyroxine after consulting with a ped endo, but said he could continue treating her.  My 1st question is..should I take her to a ped endo?  My 2nd question is regarding other symptoms...she has also been having night sweats (a few times in the last few weeks that I know of) and has a slightly enlarged (marble-size) lymph node in the back of her neck that we discovered after the dr appt.  She is also pale with dark cirlces under her eyes and tired.  Are these all normal symptoms of Hasimoto's?
title: 6yearold w/ Hashimoto's...endo?
